item.title: Why I ditched Ubuntu ?

This comes after years of frustration, Canonical’s pure neglect of basic “Ubuntu Ideals”, on the desktop front

item.title: How to Write Incremental Database Migrations for PostgreSQL Clusters
item.description: This article discusses best practices for versioned schema changes, safe column modifications, and managing replica lag across database clusters. Includes practical patterns for transactions, data batching, and rollback strategies to maintain high availability in production.

item.title: How to port-forward from EC2 instances without the need for opening any SSH ports or creating Bastion hosts
item.description: Learn how to port-forward from EC2 instances in private subnets without opening SSH ports or setting up bastion hosts. This AWS SSM Session Manager guide provides a secure, cost-effective, and simple solution for EC2 access and port forwarding.

item.title: What YouTube Tutorials Don't Tell You About DevOps & SRE (A Fresher's POV).
item.description: This article highlights the gap between idealized YouTube tutorials and real-world DevOps/SRE work, emphasizing fundamentals, debugging, and system reliability over superficial projects.

item.title: Exploring Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG): enhancing LLMs with external knowledge
item.description: Explore how Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) can enhance Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT by leveraging external knowledge sources. Understand the fundamentals of LLMs, the limitations of standalone models, and the key components of a RAG-based application.

item.title: Understanding MLOps from a software engineers' perspective
item.description: A comprehensive overview of MLOps for software engineers, covering key concepts, challenges, and best practices. Learn about knowledge silos, the MLOps lifecycle, automation, versioning, experiment tracking, and more.

item.title: How to Collect Kubernetes Node Metrics with Node-Exporter Using CronJobs ?
item.description: This article focuses on leveraging cron-jobs in Kubernetes to pull host metrics from all nodes in Kubernetes and save them as log files. A few days ago I was asked to solve this problem as part of an interview process for an SRE position. The problem is a very nice way to brush up your skills in monitoring. So, I decided to share it with all readers.

item.title: Quick Read: How do you find Long Running and Blocking Queries in Postgres?
item.description: Recently, I was working on a custom Observability suite where I needed to monitor long-running and blocking queries running on a HA Postgres Cluster running over Kubernetes using Patroni.
